channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Nascar’s Jimmie Johnson ups the rent on his pricey, renovated Aspen chalet
item.description: The beautifully luxurious historic home includes a floating glass staircase and rents for $120,000 a month.

item.title: AMD's Second AI Act Faces a Tougher Crowd
item.description: Strong sales of the chipmaker’s first GPU chips still barely make a dent in Nvidia’s armor.

item.title: Euro Stabilizes, Awaits Potential Chinese Stimulus
item.description: The euro has stabilized in the $1.09-$1.10 range against the dollar, and good news from China over the weekend could help build a floor at 1.09 early ...

item.title: Government Bonds Look Prone to Near-Term Weakness
item.description: Investors betting on bond weakness—with yields staying at current levels or even rising—have momentum on their side in the short term, LBBW said.

item.title: Obamacare Will Survive This Election---The Fight Will Be About Paying for It
item.description: Killing the Affordable Care Act would have massive repercussions, but that doesn’t make its inner workings untouchable.

item.title: BP says lower refining margins will hit profits by up to $600 million
item.description: BP said it expects the global slump in refining margins will see it take a $400 million to $600 million hit to its profits after Shell made a similar ...

item.title: ‘As his power of attorney, she had access to his emergency fund’: My mother-in-law stole thousands of dollars from my husband. What now?
item.description: “When she stopped working years ago she cared for her own father, who contributed to her home expenses.”

item.title: Beleaguered Stellantis ousts CFO, other top execs in bid to ‘redouble’ its focus
item.description: Troubled automaker Stellantis shook up its executive ranks Thursday in an effort to turn around its business, a week after slashing its annual guidanc...

item.title: Hurricane Damage and Your Taxes. Here's What to Know.
item.description: Losses from hurricanes, wildfires and other disasters may be tax deductible, and even those spared from catastrophe in 33 states may get extended tax ...

item.title: Treasury yields rise ahead of PPI report
item.description: Bond yields rose early Friday ahead of another inflation report that could influence Federal Reserve interest-rate expectations.
